Forums¶

Resource Operation Description
  POST /forums/threads/(int:id)/notes  
Forum POST /forums Create a forum.
  POST /forums/(int:forum_id)/subscribe Subscribe to a forum.
  DELETE /forums/(int:forum_id)/subscribe  
  DELETE /forums/(int:id) Delete a forum.
  PUT /forums/(int:id) Edit a forum.
  GET /forums/(int:id) View a forum.
ForumCategory POST /forums/categories Create a forum category.
  GET /forums/categories View forum categories.
  DELETE /forums/categories/(int:id) Delete a forum category.
  PUT /forums/categories/(int:id) Edit a forum category.
ForumPoll GET /forums/polls/(int:id) View a forum poll.
  POST /forums/polls/choices/(int:choice_id)/vote Vote on a forum poll.
ForumPost POST /forums/posts Create a forum post.
  DELETE /forums/posts/(int:id) Delete a forum post.
  GET /forums/posts/(int:id) View a forum post.
ForumThread PUT /forums/polls/(int:id) Edit a forum thread.
  PUT /forums/posts/(int:id) Edit a forum post.
  POST /forums/threads Create a forum thread.
  DELETE /forums/threads/(int:id) Delete a forum thread.
  PUT /forums/threads/(int:id) Edit a forum thread.
  GET /forums/threads/(int:id) View a forum thread.
  POST /forums/threads/(int:thread_id)/subscribe Subscribe to a forum thread.
  DELETE /forums/threads/(int:thread_id)/subscribe  

Categories¶

POST /forums/categories¶

This is the endpoint for forum category creation. The modify_forums permission is required to access this endpoint.

Example request:

POST /forums/categories HTTP/1.1
Host: pul.sar
Accept: application/json
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "name": "Support",
  "description": "The place for confused share bears.",
  "position": 6
}

Example response:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Accept
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "status": "success",
  "response": {
  }
}
Response JSON Object:
 
  • response (list) – The newly created forum category
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK – Creation successful
  • 400 Bad Request – Creation unsuccessful
GET /forums/categories¶

This endpoint allows users to view the available forum categories and the forums in each category, along with some information about each forum.

Example request:

GET /forums/categories HTTP/1.1
Host: pul.sar
Accept: application/json
Content-Type: application/json

Example response:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Accept
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "status": "success",
  "response": [
    {
    }
  ]
}
Response JSON Object:
 
  • response (list) – A list of forum categories
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK – View successful
  • 401 Unauthorized – View unsuccessful
DELETE /forums/categories/(int: id)¶

This is the endpoint for forum category deletion . The modify_forums permission is required to access this endpoint. The category must have no forums assigned to it in order to delete it.

Example request:

DELETE /forums/categories/2 HTTP/1.1
Host: pul.sar
Accept: application/json
Content-Type: application/json

Example response:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Accept
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "status": "success",
  "response": {
  }
}
Response JSON Object:
 
  • response (list) – The newly deleted forum category
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK – Deletion successful
  • 400 Bad Request – Deletion unsuccessful
  • 404 Not Found – Forum category does not exist
PUT /forums/categories/(int: id)¶

This is the endpoint for forum category editing. The modify_forums permission is required to access this endpoint. The name, description, and position of a forum category can be changed here.

Example request:

PUT /forums/categories/6 HTTP/1.1
Host: pul.sar
Accept: application/json
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "name": "Support",
  "description": "The place for very confused share bears.",
  "position": 99
}

Example response:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Accept
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "status": "success",
  "response": {
  }
}
Response JSON Object:
 
  • response (list) – The edited forum category
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK – Editing successful
  • 400 Bad Request – Editing unsuccessful
  • 404 Not Found – Forum category does not exist

Forums¶

POST /forums¶

This is the endpoint for forum creation. The modify_forums permission is required to access this endpoint.

Example request:

POST /forums HTTP/1.1
Host: pul.sar
Accept: application/json
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "name": "Support",
  "description": "The place for confused share bears.",
  "position": 6
}

Example response:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Accept
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "status": "success",
  "response": {
  }
}
Response JSON Object:
 
  • response (list) – The newly created forum
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK – Creation successful
  • 400 Bad Request – Creation unsuccessful
DELETE /forums/(int: id)¶

This is the endpoint for forum deletion . The modify_forums permission is required to access this endpoint. All threads in a deleted forum will also be deleted.

Example request:

DELETE /forums/2 HTTP/1.1
Host: pul.sar
Accept: application/json
Content-Type: application/json

Example response:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Accept
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "status": "success",
  "response": {
  }
}
Response JSON Object:
 
  • response (dict) – The newly deleted forum
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK – Deletion successful
  • 400 Bad Request – Deletion unsuccessful
  • 404 Not Found – Forum does not exist
PUT /forums/(int: id)¶

This is the endpoint for forum editing. The modify_forums permission is required to access this endpoint. The name, category, description, and position of a forum can be changed here.

Example request:

PUT /forums/6 HTTP/1.1
Host: pul.sar
Accept: application/json
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "name": "Support",
  "description": "The place for very confused share bears.",
  "position": 99
}

Example response:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Accept
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "status": "success",
  "response": {
  }
}
Response JSON Object:
 
  • response (dict) – The edited forum
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK – Editing successful
  • 400 Bad Request – Editing unsuccessful
  • 404 Not Found – Forum does not exist
GET /forums/(int: id)¶

This endpoint allows users to view details about a forum and its threads.

Example request:

GET /forums/1 HTTP/1.1
Host: pul.sar
Accept: application/json
Content-Type: application/json

Example response:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Accept
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "status": "success",
  "response": [
    {
    }
  ]
}
Response JSON Object:
 
  • response (list) – A list of forums
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK – View successful
  • 403 Forbidden – User does not have permission to view forum
  • 404 Not Found – Forum does not exist

Threads¶

POST /forums/threads¶

This is the endpoint for forum thread creation. The modify_forum_threads permission is required to access this endpoint.

Example request:

POST /forums/threads HTTP/1.1
Host: pul.sar
Accept: application/json
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "topic": "How do I get easy ration?",
  "forum_id": 4
}

Example response:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Accept
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "status": "success",
  "response": {
  }
}
Response JSON Object:
 
  • response (dict) – The newly created forum thread
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK – Creation successful
  • 400 Bad Request – Creation unsuccessful
DELETE /forums/threads/(int: id)¶

This is the endpoint for forum thread deletion . The modify_forum_threads_advanced permission is required to access this endpoint. All posts in a deleted forum will also be deleted.

Example request:

DELETE /forums/threads/2 HTTP/1.1
Host: pul.sar
Accept: application/json
Content-Type: application/json

Example response:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Accept
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "status": "success",
  "response": {
  }
}
Response JSON Object:
 
  • response (dict) – The deleted forum thread
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK – Deletion successful
  • 400 Bad Request – Deletion unsuccessful
  • 404 Not Found – Forum thread does not exist
PUT /forums/threads/(int: id)¶

This is the endpoint for forum thread editing. The modify_forum_threads permission is required to access this endpoint. The topic, forum_id, locked, and sticky attributes can be changed here.

Example request:

PUT /forums/threads/6 HTTP/1.1
Host: pul.sar
Accept: application/json
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "topic": "This does not contain typos.",
  "forum_id": 2,
  "locked": true,
  "sticky": false
}

Example response:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Accept
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "status": "success",
  "response": {
  }
}
Response JSON Object:
 
  • response (dict) – The edited forum thread
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK – Editing successful
  • 400 Bad Request – Editing unsuccessful
  • 404 Not Found – Forum thread does not exist
GET /forums/threads/(int: id)¶

This endpoint allows users to view details about a forum and its threads.

Example request:

GET /forums/threads/1 HTTP/1.1
Host: pul.sar
Accept: application/json

Example response:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Accept
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "status": "success",
  "response": [
    {
    }
  ]
}
Response JSON Object:
 
  • response (list) – A forum thread
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK – View successful
  • 403 Forbidden – User does not have permission to view thread
  • 404 Not Found – Thread does not exist
POST /forums/threads/(int: id)/notes¶

Endpoint for forum thread note creation. Limited to those with modify_forum_threads permission.

Posts¶

POST /forums/posts¶

This is the endpoint for forum posting. The modify_forum_posts permission is required to access this endpoint.

Example request:

POST /forums/posts HTTP/1.1
Host: pul.sar
Accept: application/json
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "topic": "How do I get easy ration?",
  "forum_id": 4
}

Example response:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Accept
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "status": "success",
  "response": {
  }
}
Response JSON Object:
 
  • response (list) – The newly created forum post
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK – Creation successful
  • 400 Bad Request – Creation unsuccessful
DELETE /forums/posts/(int: id)¶

This is the endpoint for forum post deletion . The modify_forum_posts_advanced permission is required to access this endpoint. All posts in a deleted forum will also be deleted.

Example request:

DELETE /forums/posts/2 HTTP/1.1
Host: pul.sar
Accept: application/json
Content-Type: application/json

Example response:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Accept
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "status": "success",
  "response": {
  }
}
Response JSON Object:
 
  • response (list) – The newly deleted forum post
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK – Deletion successful
  • 400 Bad Request – Deletion unsuccessful
  • 404 Not Found – Forum post does not exist
PUT /forums/posts/(int: id)¶

This is the endpoint for forum post editing. The modify_forum_posts permission is required to access this endpoint. Posts can be marked sticky with this endpoint.

Example request:

PUT /forums/posts/6 HTTP/1.1
Host: pul.sar
Accept: application/json
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "sticky": true
}

Example response:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Accept
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "status": "success",
  "response": {
  }
}
Response JSON Object:
 
  • response (dict) – The modified forum post
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK – Modification successful
  • 400 Bad Request – Modification unsuccessful
  • 404 Not Found – Forum post does not exist
GET /forums/posts/(int: id)¶

This endpoint allows users to view a forum post.

Example request:

GET /forums/posts/1 HTTP/1.1
Host: pul.sar
Accept: application/json
Content-Type: application/json

Example response:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Accept
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "status": "success",
  "response": [
    {
    }
  ]
}
Response JSON Object:
 
  • response (list) – A forum post
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK – View successful
  • 403 Forbidden – User does not have permission to view post
  • 404 Not Found – Post does not exist

Polls¶

PUT /forums/polls/(int: id)¶

This is the endpoint for forum thread editing. The modify_forum_threads permission is required to access this endpoint. The topic, forum_id, locked, and sticky attributes can be changed here.

Example request:

PUT /forums/threads/6 HTTP/1.1
Host: pul.sar
Accept: application/json
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "topic": "This does not contain typos.",
  "forum_id": 2,
  "locked": true,
  "sticky": false
}

Example response:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Accept
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "status": "success",
  "response": {
  }
}
Response JSON Object:
 
  • response (dict) – The edited forum thread
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK – Editing successful
  • 400 Bad Request – Editing unsuccessful
  • 404 Not Found – Forum thread does not exist
GET /forums/polls/(int: id)¶

This endpoint allows users to view details about a poll.

Example request:

GET /forums/polls/1 HTTP/1.1
Host: pul.sar
Accept: application/json

Example response:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Accept
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "status": "success",
  "response": [
    {
    }
  ]
}
Response JSON Object:
 
  • response (list) – A forum poll
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK – View successful
  • 403 Forbidden – User does not have permission to view thread
  • 404 Not Found – Thread does not exist
POST /forums/polls/choices/(int: choice_id)/vote¶

This is the endpoint for forum poll voting. The forums_polls_vote permission is required to access this endpoint.

Example request:

POST /forums/polls/choices/6 HTTP/1.1
Host: pul.sar
Accept: application/json

Example response:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Accept
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "status": "success",
  "response": {
  }
}
Response JSON Object:
 
  • response (dict) – The poll choice
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK – Voting successful
  • 400 Bad Request – Voting unsuccessful
  • 404 Not Found – Poll or poll choice
